results.title: [Studying intermediatory regulation of heart rhythm using Daphnia magna as the alternative test object].
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Caffeine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002110 @@@Caffeine@@@ normalizes the HR rate D @<m>DISEASE_Coxa_Magna</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070603 @@@magna@@@, which was decreased by the cholinolytic @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine@@@ and the beta-adrenolytic @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Podosinovikova NP, Beliaev VA, Dolgo-Saburov VB. [Studying intermediatory regulation of heart rhythm using Daphnia magna as the alternative test object]. Eksp Klin Farmakol. 2009 Nov-Dec;72(6):49-51. PMID: 20095402
